attributes.comment:
I just learned of the proposed fee increase for the U.S. Citizenship and
Immigration Services docket number USCIS-2006- 0044. I have to voice my
disagreement with this proposal.

As adoptive parents waiting to travel to China next week to pic up our new son, we
found the many fees related to the adoption process somewhat of a burden on our
family budget at times. Due to the increased wait for our referral, we were
required to be refingerprinted and refile our I600A, which resulted in even more
expense than we had planned for. If the fees were higher when we were going
through the process, we would have found it even more difficult to give our new son
the family he and every child deserves. China is one of the more inexpensive
programs, and we are still going to pay more than $30k when all is said and
done. This should be more about helping orphaned children find families, not
making money. Rather than spending time coming up with new rules and fees,
the USCIS's time would be better spent changing the rules around expiration time
frames for the paperwork related to adoption and make sure people do not have to
refile in the middle of their adoption process.

Please do not pass this proposed fee increase.

Darin Fitzgerald

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Darin L. Fitzgerald
